notes: On 1 May 2020, a number of women demonstrated in Cavite to decry their families' lack of food amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. [size=no report]

Pictures of the gathering, which were uploaded online as part of online Labor Day protests, led the police to come to the residence and arrest the demonstrators, who were later let go. [size=four]

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), around 200 to 400 families from Barangays Kilada and Marbel (coded as two separate events) and another unidentified Barangay in Matalam, Cotabato, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two rival clans respectively associated with the MILF and the MNLF in the preceding days.

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), a joint military and police team recovered four improvised explosive devices (IEDs) planted by suspected NPA militants at the boundary of Barangays Pahug and Madalunot, Pinabacdao, Samar. Authorities said that the explosives were going to be used by the NPA in an imminent ambush attempt.

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), there were ongoing clashes between militias from rival clans respectively affiliated with the MILF and the MNLF in Matalam, Cotabato, following the attack of one side on a member of the other in late April. There were no reported casualties. Authorities said that the clashes were not due to an organizational conflict between the MILF and MNLF.

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), around 200 to 400 families from Barangays Kilada and Marbel (coded as two separate events) and another unidentified Barangay in Matalam, Cotabato, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two rival clans respectively associated with the MILF and the MNLF in the preceding days.

On 4 May 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a five-minute firefight in Barangay Magdawat, Pinabacdao, Samar. There were no reported casualties on either side, though the military reported retrieving several weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 4 May 2020, during a two-day battle, two rival clans both affiliated with the MILF engaged in clashes in Mamasapano, Maguindanao, following the killing and burning of a man from one of the warring clans. On 4 May 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 45-minute firefight in Barangay Pange, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. The military reported no casualties and said it retrieved weapons and other items from the rebels, thwarting what it said was a planned bomb attack. In later reports, the military said it had arrested an NPA militant who was founded wounded from the encounter.

assoc_actor_1: NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines); Labour Group (Philippines)
notes: On 5 May 2020, ABS CBN employees and members of the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines (NUJP) staged a silent protest in front of the ABS CBN headquarters in Quezon City after ABS CBN was forced off air upon the National Telecommunications Commission (NTC)'s orders. The NTC order led to widespread condemnation from media, labor, and human rights groups locally and internationally. Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has often been critical of what it perceived as biased journalism from ABS CBN and other media outlets and had threatened to direct his allies in Congress to block the ABS CBN franchise renewal. [size=no report]

source: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Manila Bulletin; Cebu Daily News; Rappler; GMA News
notes: On 5 May 2020, a radio reporter was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Daro, Dumaguete, Negros Oriental.

source: ABS CBN; HRW; Rappler; Amnesty International
notes: On 5 May 2020, the National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) in Quezon City ordered ABS CBN, the Philippines' largest broadcaster, to go off air, after its 25-year operating franchise expired the previous day and Congress failed to renew the said franchise. The order came even though the NTC assured in March that ABS CBN would be given a provisional authority to operate pending Congress' renewal of the franchise. The NTC order, which ABS CBN complied with, led to widespread condemnation from media, labor, and human rights groups locally and internationally. Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has often been critical of what it perceived as biased journalism from ABS CBN and other media outlets. Duterte had previously threatened to direct his allies in Congress to block the ABS CBN franchise renewal.

On 5 May 2020, during a two-day battle, two rival clans both affiliated with the MILF engaged in clashes in Mamasapano, Maguindanao, following the killing and burning of a man from one of the warring clans. The ensuing clashes led to another death and one wounded. Reports indicated that the clashes were rooted in a clan feud. Two fatalities distributed across two days.

On 5 May 2020, during two days of displacement and evacuation, 840 families from Barangays Tuka and Tukanalipao (coded separately across two days for both Barangays) in Mamasapano, Maguindanao, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two warring clans affiliated with the MILF.

On 6 May 2020, a drug suspect and his companion, a suspected robbery gang leader, were killed during a police raid in Barangay Tagapo, Santa Rosa, Laguna. The military said the rebels also used landmines, while government forces were provided air support. The military said it recovered several weapons and other items from the NPA during the fighting and that high-ranking rebel leaders were killed, leading purportedly to the collapse of the rebel group's presence in the area.
On 10 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed while another was arrested during a police raid in Barangay Hagonoy, Taguig. Police said they recovered 100 grams of shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects.

notes: On 10 May 2020, a hacienda caretaker, who was also a farmer and former auxiliary of the military's Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU), was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Trinidad, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental.

On 10 May 2020, two rival clans respectively affiliated with the MILF and the MNLF engaged in firefights in Barangays Takipan, Bulol and Talitay (coded as three separate events) in Pikit, Cotabato. The rival militias also reportedly burned homes and looted property and livestock. Despite the reported use of machine guns and mortars, there were no reported fatalities on either side. Authorities said that the hostilities were rooted in rido (clan feud), fueled in this case by a land dispute. The local government, as well as representatives of the MILF and the MNLF, reportedly intervened to end the rido.

Around 15 May 2020 (month of), a forester of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Palo (Leyte, Eastern Visayas) while he was doing field work. Authorities believed that the motive for the attack was related to the victim's work.

Around 15 May 2020 (month of), the military recovered four IEDs planted by suspected NPA militants along the national highway in Jiabong (Samar, Eastern Visayas). The military said that this thwarted a planned ambush by the NPA.

notes: On 16 May 2020, during a six-day battle between the NPA and the military, a number of NPA militants were killed during continuing firefights between the NPA and the military in the Andap Valley in Surigao del Sur (coded at San Miguel). 11 NPA fatalities were officially recorded by the military (11 fatalities distributed across six days), though it added that it believed an additional number of rebels, including four top-ranking leaders, were either killed or seriously wounded during the six-day battle. The military also reported that it recovered several weapons and other items from the NPA and that it overran a large NPA camp in the area.

source: ABS CBN; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Manila Times; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 17 May 2020, during a six-day battle between the NPA and the military, a number of NPA militants were killed during continuing firefights between the NPA and the military in the Andap Valley in Surigao del Sur (coded at San Miguel). 11 NPA fatalities were officially recorded by the military (11 fatalities distributed across six days), though it added that it believed an additional number of rebels, including four top-ranking leaders, were either killed or seriously wounded during the six-day battle. The military also reported that it recovered several weapons and other items from the NPA and that it overran a large NPA camp in the area.

On 17 May 2020, the family members and fellow activists of the slain former coordinator of Bayan Muna in Iloilo, killed by suspected police elements in late April, staged a demonstration during his funeral in Iloilo City, Iloilo. The demonstrators condemned the killing and called for justice. [size=no report]

source: Manila Bulletin; Philippine Information Agency; Mindanao Goldstar Daily
notes: On 18 May 2020, an NPA militant was shot dead while an undetermined number of rebels were reportedly wounded during a 45-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Siagao, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur. The military also reported that it overran an NPA camp in the area and that it recovered weapons and other items from the rebels. On 23 July 2020, the body of another rebel who died in the clash was found and reported by the military.

On 18 May 2020, two suspected BIFF militants were killed while two others were wounded in a five-hour firefight with the military in Barangay Lower Salbu, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. Another clash happened in the same area a few hours later, without any additional reported casualties on either side.

On 18 May 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Mambaling, Cebu City, Cebu. While the motive for the killing was unclear, police said that the fatality had attacked and wounded a COVID-19 quarantine implementation volunteer two days prior, after being denied access to an unspecified area and supposedly being prevented from buying drugs.

On 18 May 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a firefight in Barangay Tibagon, Pantukan, Davao de Oro. There were no reported casualties on either side. The military said it arrested a suspected NPA courier and overran an NPA camp in the area, seizing weapons and substantial food supplies.

On 18 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Papaya, San Antonio, Nueva Ecija. Police said that the suspect was on the town's drug watchlist and that they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from him during the operation.

On 18 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Tejeros Convention, Rosario, Cavite. Police said that the suspect was the leader of a criminal gang and was on the town's drug watchlist. Police also said they recovered drugs from the suspect.

source: Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Manila Bulletin; Manila Times; ABS CBN
notes: On 18 May 2020, during a six-day battle between the NPA and the military, a number of NPA militants were killed during continuing firefights between the NPA and the military in the Andap Valley in Surigao del Sur (coded at San Miguel). 11 NPA fatalities were officially recorded by the military (11 fatalities distributed across six days), though it added that it believed an additional number of rebels, including four top-ranking leaders, were either killed or seriously wounded during the six-day battle. The military also reported that it recovered several weapons and other items from the NPA and that it overran a large NPA camp in the area.

source: Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Manila Times; Manila Bulletin; ABS CBN
notes: On 19 May 2020, during a six-day battle between the NPA and the military, a number of NPA militants were killed during continuing firefights between the NPA and the military in the Andap Valley in Surigao del Sur (coded at San Miguel). 11 NPA fatalities were officially recorded by the military (11 fatalities distributed across six days), though it added that it believed an additional number of rebels, including four top-ranking leaders, were either killed or seriously wounded during the six-day battle. The military also reported that it recovered several weapons and other items from the NPA and that it overran a large NPA camp in the area.

actor1: AKP: Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines
source: Abante; Philippine News Agency; Philippine Star
notes: On 19 May 2020, a soldier was shot dead by suspected militants from the BIFF faction Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines (AKP) in Barangay Sapakan, Rajah Buayan, Maguindanao. The soldier was returning to his command post with his fellow soldiers from a shift at a COVID-19 quarantine checkpoint. The other soldiers returned fire, but the militants escaped.

On 19 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Lagao, General Santos, South Cotabato. Police said that the slain suspect was a high-value target who was on Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's so-called narco list of prominent personalities allegedly connected to the drug trade, which has been publicly released on multiple occasions since 2016. Police said they recovered several grams of shabu from the suspect during the operation.
On 19 May 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Assumption, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan.

On 19 May 2020, an NPA militant who had reportedly expressed his desire to leave the rebel group was allegedly executed by his comrades in Abra after being tagged as a government spy, according to the slain militant's family.

On 20 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Santa Rita Bata, San Miguel, Bulacan. Police said that the suspect was on the unified drug watchlist of the Philippine National Police and the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: On 20 May 2020, a former barangay watchman was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Holy Spirit, Quezon City. The motive for the attack was unclear, though police said that the fatality was also a theft suspect.

actor1: AKP: Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines
notes: On 20 May 2020, a suspected militant from the BIFF faction Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines (AKP) and a government soldier were killed during a firefight between the AKP and the military in Barangay Tabungao, Rajah Buayan, Maguindanao.

On 20 May 2020, a civilian was killed while another was wounded in an attack by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Jamorawon, Milagros, Masbate. The motive for the attack was unclear. One of the three suspected militants was caught and arrested by the police.
On 21 May 2020, suspected BIFF militants fired mortar shells at an army detachment in Salbu, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. There were no reported casualties.
On 21 May 2020, suspected BIFF militants fired mortar shells at an army detachment in Madia, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. There were no reported casualties.
On 21 May 2020, suspected BIFF militants fired mortar shells at an army detachment in Elian, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. There were no reported casualties.

On 21 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Cabaruan, Cauayan City, Isabela. Police said they recovered two sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from the suspect during the operation.

On 22 May 2020, a suspected NPA militant was shot dead in a 25-minute firefight with a police team on patrol in Barangay Santa Cruz Norte, Iriga, Camarines Sur. Police recovered weapons from the rebels.

actor1: AKP: Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines
notes: On 22 May 2020, a suspected militant of the BIFF faction Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines (AKP) was shot dead in a 20-minute firefight between the AKP and the military in Barangay Tabungao, Rajah Buayan, Maguindanao. The military said that the slain militant was suspected of having been the one who killed a soldier in an encounter in Barangay Sapakan on 19 May, which triggered the pursuit operations.

On 22 May 2020, a civilian was shot dead by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Kawayan, San Fernando, Bukidnon. The civilian was reportedly the son of a barangay chairperson who was supportive of government forces' local campaigns against the NPA.

On 22 May 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a five-minute firefight in Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. The military said that it suffered no casualties and that there was an undetermined number of NPA wounded, as indicated by bloodstains in the area. The military said it retrieved the rebels' personal belongings.

On 22 May 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Tejero, Cebu City, Cebu. Police said the fatality had served time in jail on drug charges, though the motive for the killing was unclear.
On 22 May 2020, suspected BIFF militants fired mortar shells in Dapiawan, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. A civilian was hit and killed.
On 22 May 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Lower Bicutan, Taguig. Police said they recovered several kilos of shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects during the operation.

On 23 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bagong Nayon, Baliuag, Bulacan. Police said that the slain suspect was on the unified drug watchlist of the Philippine National Police and the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency. Police also reported retrieving sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from the suspect.
On 23 May 2020, two suspected BIFF militants were shot dead during a firefight with the military in Barangay Tuka, Mamasapano, Maguindanao.

On 23 May 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Guindaruhan, Minglanilla, Cebu. Police said the motive for the attack was unclear, but mentioned that the victim had previously been detained on drug charges before being released in March 2020 through a plea bargaining agreement.
On 23 May 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 155, Tondo, Manila. Police said that the fatality was on the barangay drug watchlist.

On 23 May 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Balabago, Iloilo City, Iloilo. Police said that the suspect was thought to be linked to the Prevendido drug group, though it added that it was also looking at possible personal motives behind the attack.
On 23 May 2020, during a two-day battle, the BIFF and the military engaged in firefights in Barangay Elian, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. No details were available.
Around 24 May 2020 (as reported), an unexploded IED planted by unidentified assailants was found at a police station in Datu Salibo, Maguindanao.
On 24 May 2020, during a two-day battle, the BIFF and the military engaged in firefights in Barangay Elian, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. No details were available.

source: Philippine Star; ABS CBN; GMA News; Manila Bulletin; Cebu Daily News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Mindanao Goldstar Daily
notes: On 24 May 2020, two children were killed while around 15 other people were wounded amid Eid'l Fit'r celebrations, after suspected BIFF militants fired a mortar shell at a private residence in a Moro Muslim community in Barangay Kitango, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. The private residence was that of a cameraman employed at the city hall, who was among the wounded. The identity of the assailants could not be definitively established days after the attack, with police and military probes ongoing, though the BIFF was tagged in multiple reports as the likeliest suspect given their known active presence in the area.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 24 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed while another was arrested during a shootout with the police in Barangay Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental. One police officer was wounded during the shootout. Police said sachets of shabu (crystal meth) were retrieved from the slain suspect during the operation.

On 25 May 2020, two suspected BIFF militants were shot dead in a 20-minute firefight with the military in Barangay Tuka, Mamasapano, Maguindanao. The military said that, apart from weapons, it also retrieved a sachet of shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects.
Around 25 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Santo Nino 3rd, San Jose, Nueva Ecija. Police said the slain suspect was a member of the Pajares Diablo crime group.
Around 25 May 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay San Ignacio, San Pablo, Laguna.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: On 25 May 2020, a barangay watchman was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Lubigan, Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur. The motive for the attack was unclear.

source: Abante; GMA News; Philippine Star; ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Bulletin; Rappler
notes: On 25 May 2020, the Cotabato City mayor's executive assistant - also a former broadcaster - was shot dead by unidentified assailants along Notre Dame Avenue in Cotabato City, Maguindanao. The motive for the attack was unclear, though there had been a previous attempt on the executive assistant's life in July 2015.

On 26 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bonuan Boquig, Dagupan, Pangasinan. Police said that the slain suspect was the leader of the Balong drug group and that they retrieved four sachets of marijuana from him during the operation.

Around 26 May 2020 (as reported), about 210 families from San Fernando, Bukidnon evacuated from highland villages to the town proper after an NPA attack on a resident of Barangay Kawayan on 22 May. The military said that the NPA was harassing residents in the highland villages in the preceding days.

On 26 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed while his companion was wounded during a police raid in Barangay Cansilayan, Murcia, Negros Occidental. Police said that they initially pursued the suspect upon reports that he and his companion were loitering in the area, but they later retrieved two sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from him.

assoc_actor_2: MILF: Moro Islamic Liberation Front; Teachers (Philippines)
source: Tempo (Philippines); ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 26 May 2020, a Mindanao State University professor and peace advocate - who was also a board member of the MILF development arm, the Bangsamoro Development Agency, and of the Local Monitoring Team of the MILF as part of the peace process with the government - was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Apopong, General Santos, South Cotabato. The professor's wife was also lightly injured. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 26 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay MS Garcia, Cabanatuan, Nueva Ecija.

On 26 May 2020, a drug suspect who was also a businessman was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Sum-ag, Bacolod, Negros Occidental. Police said that the slain suspect had just been freed in October 2019 after being detained on drug charges.

Around 26 May 2020 (as reported), a suspected NPA militant was killed during a firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Mahagsay, San Luis, Agusan del Sur. The military said that bloodstains in the area indicated that there might have been severely wounded NPA rebels. The military reported no casualties and said it retrieved weapons and other items from the rebels.

assoc_actor_2: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)
source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Abante; Philippine Star
notes: On 27 May 2020, a farmer and organizer who chaired local KMP affiliate Northern Samar Small Farmers Association was shot dead by the military in Barangay New Rizal, Catarman, Northern Samar. The military initially reported that the slain farmer was an NPA militant and that they recovered a weapon from him. However, KMP and human rights groups such as Karapatan asserted that the fatality was a civilian farmer.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Information Agency; Mindanao Goldstar Daily
notes: On 27 May 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 30-minute firefight in Barangay Mainit, Iligan, Lanao del Norte. The military said one soldier was wounded, and that an undetermined number of NPA rebels were also wounded based on bloodstains found in the area.
On 27 May 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Manghinao Proper, Bauan, Batangas. Police said the slain suspect was on the town's drug watchlist.

Around 27 May 2020 (as reported), 6,410 residents of Dapiawan, Elian, and Kitango in Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao, evacuated from the said villages following clashes between the BIFF and the military in the preceding days.

On 28 May 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Taft North, Iloilo City, Iloilo. Police said that the suspect had been involved in theft and illegal drugs.

On 28 May 2020, a drug suspect also identified as a BIFF militant and bombmaker was killed during an encounter with the police in Barangay New Cebu, Lambayong, Sultan Kudarat. Police said that they recovered nine sachets of shabu (crystal meth), weapons and explosives from the slain suspect during the operation.

On 28 May 2020, a member and former national secretary-general of urban poor group KADAMAY was shot dead by suspected military elements in Barangay Guintigui-an, Ormoc, Leyte. KADAMAY is often red-tagged by the government. KADAMAY, as well as other human rights and political groups, condemned the killing.
On 28 May 2020, suspected NPA militants allegedly set an evangelical church and four houses on fire in Barangay Limonda, Opol, Misamis Oriental.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 28 May 2020, a retired police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Kalunasan, Cebu City, Cebu. The motive for the attack was unclear, though police said it might be related to his previous post as a police officer.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 28 May 2020, a drug suspect (also a traffic enforcer) was killed during a police raid in Barangay Gumaoc Central, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan. Police said they recovered several sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from the drug suspect. The suspect was killed in the middle of an undercover drug deal and is assumed off-duty as traffic enforcer. Two other suspects were also arrested.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 28 May 2020, a civilian worker was shot dead while a military Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) auxiliary was wounded during a three- to six-minute firefight between the NPA and the active CAFGU detachment by a government water works project in Barangay Bunog, Rizal, Palawan. Authorities said that an undetermined number of NPA militants were seen wounded.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 29 May 2020, a drug suspect - a barangay watchman - was killed during a police raid in Barangay Kawas, Alabel, Sarangani. The captain of the barangay was also reportedly killed by the same police officers after he was called to the operation site and allegedly refused to sign a witness statement concerning the operation. Prior to the drug suspect's killing, the barangay captain had reportedly begged the police to only arrest the drug suspect and to allow him to face due process. Human rights group Karapatan also said that the slain barangay captain was a housing rights advocate.

On 29 May 2020, a police officer was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Santa Maria, Licab, Nueva Ecija. The police officer was on his way home and is assumed off-duty.
On 29 May 2020, a barangay councilor was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay West Dalurong, Kitaotao, Bukidnon. The motive for the attack was unclear.

Around 30 May 2020 (weekend of), two suspected NPA militants were killed in a firefight with the police in Senator Ninoy Aquino, Sultan Kudarat. The firefight took place during an entrapment operation that police said was aimed at stopping the NPA's alleged extortion activities in the area. Police said they recovered weapons from the rebels.

source: ABS CBN; Philippine Star; Manila Times
notes: On 30 May 2020, two drug suspects were killed while five others were arrested during a police raid in Barangay Rosary Heights 6, Cotabato City, Maguindanao.
On 31 May 2020, the military allegedly carried out a bombing operation in a Mangyan farmland in Socorro (Oriental Mindoro, Mimaropa Region), according to the NPA.
